newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates end up on c.bank mop-up move.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates end up on c.bank mop-up move.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates closed sharply higher on Tuesday, reflecting tightened liquidity in the banking system following the central bank's mop-up measure on Monday, dealers said.

The overnight interbank rate finished at 6.856 percent against Monday's 6.588 finish -- outside the central bank's 5.0-5.5 percent target zone but still far below the double-digit closes of late June.
The 30-day commercial paper rose to 7.25 percent against 6.50-6.75.
The central bank on Monday issued T$11 billion negotiable certificates of deposit.
Dealers expected the overnight interbank rate to rise to around 7.00 percent on Wednesday as the island's sizzling stock market continued to siphon money out of the banking system.
The benchmark index eased slightly on Tuesday, closing 0.19 percent or 17.57 points lower at 9,305.27. But turnover remained heavy at T$175.79 billion.
In the bond market, the benchmark 10-year 86/4 bond yield was traded at 5.8970-5.9450 percent range.
